tit.j: 青葉山 (京都府・福井県)
tit.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。

sen.j: 青葉山（あおばさん、あおばやま）は、京都府舞鶴市と福井県大飯郡高浜町の境界に峙える山で、高浜町の最高峰である。
sen.e: Aoba-yama (or Aoba-san) Mountain, the highest in Takahama Cho, soars in an area where Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture and Takahama Cho, Oi Gun, Fukui Prefecture, are bordered.
Aoba-yama (or Aoba-san) Mountain, the highest in Takahama Cho, is located where Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture and Takahama Cho, Oi Gun, Fukui Prefecture, are bordered.
Mt. Aoba, the highest in Takahama-cho, is located where Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture and Takahama-cho, Oi-gun, Fukui Prefecture, are bordered.

sen.j: 東峰（693m）、西峰（692m）の二峰から成る双耳峰の総称である。
sen.e: It is the name covering both of the twin peaks of the east peak (693 m) and the west peak (692 m).
The name refers to both the east peak (693 m) and the west peak (692 m).
The name is used to refer to the mountain's east peak (693 m) and west peak (692 m) collectively.
sen.cmt: The revised version is closer in structure to the Japanese.

sen.j: 国土地理院の測量成果による地形図では、東峰に山名の記載があるため、これに従うと標高は693mである。
sen.e: On the topographic maps based on measurements by GeographucalSurvey Institute, the mounain name is written at the position of the east peak, and therefore, the altitude is 693 m when based on the maps.
The mounain name is written at the position of the east peak in topographic maps based on maeasurements by the Geographical Survvey Institute. Therefore, the altitude is 693 m when based on the maps.

The mountain name is written at the position of the east peak in topographic maps based on measurements by the Geographical Survey Institute, therefore, the altitude is 693 meters when based on the maps.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: いずれの山頂も高浜町に所在する。
sen.e: Both of the peaks are located in Takahama Cho.
Both of the peaks are located in Takahama Cho.
Both of the peaks are located in Takahama-cho.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 東西2つのピークを持つ双耳峰で、古くには扶桑馬耳山と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: This mountain has twin peaks of the east peak and the west peak, and was called Fusobaji-san Mountain in old times.
This mountain has twin peaks, the east and the west peak, and was called Fusobaji-san Mountain in old times.
This mountain has twin peaks, the east and the west peak, and was called Mt. Fusobaji in old times.
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。

sen.j: 東部海岸から眺める山容が秀麗な景観を見せることから、現在では俗に「若狭富士」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Since the shape of the moutain that can be viewed from the eastern sea side is beautiful, it is popularly called Wakasa Fuji.
Since the shape of the moutain that can be viewed from the eastern sea side is beautiful, it is popularly called Wakasa Fuji.
Since the shape of the mountain that can be viewed from the eastern sea side is beautiful, it is popularly called Wakasa Fuji.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 古代に国造が分立した時代には、青葉山を境にして、東側がヤマト王権の領土で、西側が丹国の領土であった。
sen.e: In ancient times when many provinces existed, the east side of Aoba-yama Mountain was a territoty of the Yamato authorities and the west side that of Ni Province.
In ancient times when many provinces existed, the east side of Aoba-yama Mountain was a territoty of the Yamato authorities and the west side that of Ni Province.
In ancient times when many provinces existed, the east side of Mt. Aoba was a territory of the Yamato authorities and the west side that of Ni Province.
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。

sen.j: 青葉山は信仰との関わりが深い山でもある。
sen.e: Aoba-yama Mountain is deeply concerned with worship.
Aoba-yama Mountain is deeply connected with worship.
Mt. Aoba is deeply connected with worship.
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。

sen.j: 舞鶴市側の西中腹には西国三十三箇所第29番札所である松尾寺 (舞鶴市)が創建され、高浜町側の東中腹には中山寺 (高浜町)が創建された。
sen.e: In the middle of the western side, the Maizuru side, of the mountain, Matsunoo-dera Temple (located in Maizuru City), the 29th of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples especially worshiped in western Japan) was constructed, and In the middle of the eastern side, the Takahama Cho side, Nakayama-dera Temple (located in Takahama Cho) was constructed.

In the middle of the western side, the Maizuru side, of the mountain, Matsunoo-dera Temple (located in Maizuru City), the 29th of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples especially worshiped in western Japan) was constructed, and In the middle of the eastern side, the Takahama Cho side, Nakayama-dera Temple (located in Takahama Cho) was constructed.

In the middle of the western side, the Maizuru side, of the mountain, Matsunoo-dera Temple (Maizuru City), No. 29 pilgrim stamp office of the 33 Temples of Saigoku was constructed, and in the middle of the eastern side, the Takahama-cho side, Nakayama-dera Temple (Takahama-cho) was constructed.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。"the twenty-ninth of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the thirty-three temples especially worshiped in western Japan)" -> "No. 29 pilgrim stamp office of the 33 Temples of Saigoku"

sen.j: 両寺とも山号を「青葉山」としている。
sen.e: The "sango (literally a mountain name)"(the sango of a temple was mostly used to indicate where the temple is located) of both of the templs is "Aoba-yama Mountain."
The "sango (literally a mountain name)"(the sango of a temple was mostly used to indicate where the temple is located) of both of the templs is "Aoba-yama Mountain."
The "sango" (literally a mountain name) (the sango of a temple was mostly used to indicate where the temple is located) of both of the temples is 'Mt. Aoba.'
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。

sen.j: また、東峰の山頂には青葉神社、西峰の山頂には青葉神社西権現が祀られている。
sen.e: For worship, Aoba-jinja Shrine is placed at the east peal and the west avatar of Aoba-jinja Shrine at the west peak.
For worship, Aoba-jinja Shrine is placed at the east peal and the west avatar of Aoba-jinja Shrine at the west peak.
For worship, Aoba-jinja Shrine is placed at the east peak and the west avatar of Aoba-jinja Shrine at the west peak.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 山腹には青葉山にだけ自生するオミナエシ科の多年草「オオキンレイカ」のほか、イワヒバ科のヒモカズラなど、きわめて重要な種が多く分布している。
sen.e: Many important species of plants, such as Himokazura (Selaginella shakotanensis) of Selaginellaceae, in addition to Okishireika (Patrinia takeuchiana Makino) of the Valerian family, which grows naturally only in this mountain, exisit on the hill side.

Many important species of plants, such as Himokazura (Selaginella shakotanensis) of Selaginellaceae, in addition to Okishireika (Patrinia takeuchiana Makino) of the Valerian family, which grows naturally only in this mountain, exist on the hill side.

Many important species of plants, such as Himokazura (Selaginella shakotanensis) of Selaginellaceae, in addition to Okishireika (Patrinia takeuchiana Makino) of the Valerian family, which grows naturally only in this mountain, exist on the hill side.

sen.j: 若狭湾国定公園に含まれ、山頂からの展望も良いことから、住民だけではなく、多くの参拝者や登山客が訪れる。
sen.e: Being included in the Wakasa-wan Bay quasi-national park and presenting fine views from its peaks, it is visited by many worshippers and mountaineers.
Being included in the Wakasa-wan Bay quasi-national park and presenting fine views from its peaks, it is visited by many worshippers and mountaineers.
Being included in the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park and presenting fine views from its peaks, it is visited by many worshippers and mountaineers.
sen.cmt: 若狭湾国定公園 の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 地質
sen.e: Natures of the soil
Natures of the soil
Natures of the soil

sen.j: 鮮新世前後に活動していた火山が侵食した結果、現在の青葉山の山体が形成されたと推定されている。
sen.e: It is considered that the present mountain shape of Aoba-yam Mountain was formed by the erosion of a volcano that was active around the Pliocene.
It is considered that the present mountain shape of Aoba-yam Mountain was formed by the erosion of a volcano that was active around the Pliocene.
It is considered that the present mountain shape of Mt. Aoba was formed by the erosion of a volcano that was active around the Pliocene.
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。

sen.j: これは火山の定義からは外れているため、第四紀火山には分類されない。
sen.e: Because this means that the mountain does not meet the definition of a volcano, it is not classified into a valcano in the Quarternary period.
Because this means that the mountain does not meet the definition of a volcano, it is not classified into a volcano in the Quarternary period.
Because this means that the mountain does not meet the definition of a volcano, it is not classified into a volcano in the Quarternary period.

sen.j: 山は安山岩と火山砕屑岩から成る。
sen.e: The mountain is made of andesite and pyroclastic rock.
The mountain is made of andesite and pyroclastic rock.
The mountain is made of andesite and pyroclastic rock.

sen.j: 交通
sen.e: Transportation
Transportation
Transportation

sen.j: 青葉山の南麓を西日本旅客鉄道小浜線、国道27号が併走する。
sen.e: The Obama Line of West Japan Railway Company and national road 27 are located in parallel along the south foot of Aob-yam Mountain.
The Obama Line of West Japan Railway Company and national road 27 are located in parallel along the south foot of Aob-yam Mountain.
The Obama Line of West Japan Railway Company and National Route 27 run in parallel along the south foot of Mt. Aoba.
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: いずれも京都府と福井県を結び、青葉山へのアクセスへと利用されている。
sen.e: Both of them connect Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto Prefecture, used for accessing Aoba-yama Mountain.
Both of them connect Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto Prefecture, used for accessing Aoba-yama Mountain.
Both of them connect Fukui Prefecture to Kyoto Prefecture, used for accessing Mt. Aoba.
sen.cmt: Mt. という表現にしました。
